subject: IGCSE Global Perspectives

overview.description: Cambridge IGCSE Global Perspectives curriculum designed to develop students' ability to think critically about global issues, understand different perspectives, and develop research and communication skills

learning_objectives: Develop understanding of global issues and their interconnected nature
Analyze different perspectives on local, national, and global topics
Master research, analysis, and evaluation skills
Communicate ideas effectively through various media
Develop collaborative and independent learning skills

units.title: Belief Systems and Identity
learning_outcomes: Understand how belief systems shape identity and worldview
Analyze the role of religion, culture, and values in global conflicts
Evaluate different approaches to religious and cultural diversity
Develop respect for different belief systems and perspectives

lessons.title: Religious Diversity and Conflict Resolution
objectives: Analyze how religious differences contribute to global conflicts
Evaluate different approaches to promoting religious tolerance
Research case studies of successful interfaith dialogue

activities.description: Analyze current conflicts with religious dimensions from multiple perspectives
Simulate interfaith dialogue sessions on contentious issues
Develop proposals for promoting religious understanding and tolerance
Reflect on personal biases and the importance of religious literacy

resources: Current news articles on religious conflicts
Academic sources on religion and conflict
cross_curricular_connections: History: Historical religious conflicts and resolutions

units.title: Climate Change and Environmental Sustainability
learning_outcomes: Understand the scientific basis and global impact of climate change
Analyze different national and regional responses to environmental challenges
Evaluate the effectiveness of international environmental policies
Develop personal and community action plans for sustainability

lessons.title: Global Climate Policy Analysis and Local Action
objectives: Analyze different national approaches to climate change mitigation
Evaluate the effectiveness of international climate agreements
Develop local action plans for environmental sustainability

activities.description: Compare climate policies of different countries and evaluate effectiveness
Analyze climate issues from perspectives of different stakeholders
Develop practical environmental action plans for school or community
Prepare presentations on research findings and action plans

cross_curricular_connections: Science: Climate science and environmental systems
Geography: Global environmental patterns and impacts

units.title: Economic Development and Global Trade
learning_outcomes: Understand patterns of global economic development and inequality
Analyze the impact of globalization on different communities
Evaluate different approaches to reducing global poverty
Understand the role of fair trade and ethical consumption

lessons.title: Fair Trade and Ethical Consumption Investigation
objectives: Investigate the global supply chains of common products
Analyze the impact of fair trade on producer communities
Evaluate consumer power in promoting ethical production

activities.description: Trace the supply chains of everyday products from source to consumer
Analyze the economic and social impacts of fair trade initiatives
Develop campaigns to promote ethical consumption in school community
Prepare for debate on effectiveness of consumer activism

resources: Supply chain mapping tools and data
Fair trade organization reports and case studies
cross_curricular_connections: Economics: Global trade and development economics
Business Studies: Corporate responsibility and ethics

units.title: Technology, Communication, and Digital Citizenship
learning_outcomes: Understand the global impact of digital technology on society
Analyze issues of digital divide and technological inequality
Evaluate the role of social media in democracy and social movements
Develop skills in digital citizenship and online ethics

lessons.title: Digital Rights and Global Digital Divide
objectives: Analyze the global digital divide and its implications
Evaluate different approaches to expanding digital access
Understand digital rights and responsibilities in global context

activities.description: Research and map global patterns of digital access and inequality
Compare different national approaches to expanding digital access
Analyze digital rights issues in different political and cultural contexts
Develop proposals for promoting digital equity and rights

resources: Global digital access statistics and reports
cross_curricular_connections: ICT: Technology systems and digital literacy

research_skills: Using primary and secondary sources effectively
analysis_skills: Analyzing complex global issues from multiple perspectives
communication_skills: Presenting research findings clearly and persuasively
Using appropriate media and technology for communication
Adapting communication style for different audiences

assessment_objectives: AO1: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of global issues
AO2: Analyze and evaluate different perspectives on global issues
AO3: Synthesize evidence to support arguments and conclusions
AO4: Communicate ideas clearly through various forms
coursework_requirements: Independent research on chosen global issue
Clear communication of findings and conclusions

formative_assessments: Weekly current events analysis and discussion
Research skills practice and peer review

textbooks: Cambridge IGCSE Global Perspectives Complete Coursebook
Current affairs and global issues compilations
digital_resources: Online research tools and academic databases
supplementary_materials: Cultural exchange and international partnership opportunities

global_competency_development.cultural_awareness: Understanding and respect for diverse cultural perspectives
global_competency_development.critical_thinking: Analytical skills for complex global issues
global_competency_development.collaboration: Working effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders
global_competency_development.ethical_reasoning: Making informed decisions with global awareness
